content: front loop m1l = pick up the top strand of the ladder between your right and left needle so that the right l eg of the stitch is coming over the front of the left needle knit through the back loop p2tog bind-off p2tog move just-worked st back to left-hand needle repeat until all sts h ave been worked © 2014 by b s knees knits helpful hints a tutorial for the german twisted cast-on is here http //www knittinghelp com/video/play/ g erman-twisted-cast-on to make a man s mitt co 48 sts and knit the thumb gusset until there were 19 sts between the markers on the thumb gusset after removing the thumb sts to the waste yarn proceed with the r emainder of the directions as written more yarn will be used when knitting the man s size mitts to make a child s mitt co 32 sts follow same directions but knit the thumb gusset until there are 11 sts between the markers on the thumb gusset after removing the thumb sts to the waste yarn proceed with the remainder of the directions as written less yarn will be used knitting the c hild s size mitts the child i have sized these for is 9 years-old and used 73 yds of yarn my yardage estimates are generous- actual yardage used in knitting these mitts has been closer t o 110 yds as judged by weighing the yarn prior to knitting the mitts and after knitting them on the last row of the thumb gusset i find that if i knit some sts tight i get a better thumb gusset these sts are on the last row of the gusset- the sts in the corners- those being the last st of the hand and the first st of the thumb gusset and then the last st of the thumb gusset and the first st of the hand on the next row i knit tight the last st of the hand the backwards-loop cast-on st and the first st of the new round this helps to avoid a gap where the thumb has been joined © 2014 by b s knees knits
